people_also_ask.question: What does being security mean?
people_also_ask.heading: 1 : the quality or state of being secure: such as. a : freedom from danger : safety. b : freedom from fear or anxiety. c : freedom from the prospect of being laid off job security.
people_also_ask.title: Security Definition & Meaning - Merriam-Webster

people_also_ask.question: What is purpose of security?
people_also_ask.heading: The goal of IT security is to protect these assets, devices and services from being disrupted, stolen or exploited by unauthorized users, otherwise known as threat actors. These threats can be external or internal and malicious or accidental in both origin and nature.
people_also_ask.title: What is Security? - SearchSecurity - TechTarget

people_also_ask.question: How do you describe security?
people_also_ask.heading: Security is freedom from, or resilience against, potential harm (or other unwanted coercive change) caused by others. Beneficiaries (technically referents) of security may be of persons and social groups, objects and institutions, ecosystems or any other entity or phenomenon vulnerable to unwanted change.
people_also_ask.title: Security - Wikipedia

people_also_ask.question: What does it mean to take security?
people_also_ask.heading: Security means safety, as well as the measures taken to be safe or protected. In order to provide adequate security for the parade, town officials often hire extra guards. A small child will sometimes latch on to a blanket or stuffed animal that gives him or her the feeling of security.

def_list.definition: the state of being free from danger or threat.
def_list.example: "the system is designed to provide maximum security against toxic spills"
